$AAPL is preparing to use $INTC 18A process for entry-level M chips as early as 2027. 

The volumes are tiny relative to Apple‚Äôs core silicon roadmap so it doesn‚Äôt move the needle for $TSM which will still own the high-end & high-volume work.

What it does show is that IFS may have finally stopped bleeding & is starting to matter again & it confirms that Apple wants a U.S. second source in its supply chain.

$SPY is about to trigger the Zweig Breadth Thrust indicator which basically means the market goes from ‚Äúno one is buying‚Äù to ‚Äúeveryone is buying‚Äù in a very short amount of time.

It almost never happens & when it does it usually marks the beginning of a real trend rather than a short bounce. Perfect example was the last time it triggered was near the April lows & that ended up being the start of a HUGE move higher.

Every single instance going back to the 1950s has led to higher S&P levels one year later.

If the Thanksgiving conversation five years ago was that AI was about to change the world then these are the names that ended up proving it.

*SPOT SILVER HITS NEW RECORD HIGH, SURPASSING OCTOBER PEAK
Now over $55

2025 has been an amazing year for precious metals.

7/7

But, as I explained in this thread a few days ago, 86 million homebuyers are terrified of lower prices. 

So, we talk all day about affordability, and never do anything about it.

And this will worsen the K-shaped economy.

nitter.net/biancoresearch/status/‚Ä¶

6/7

This is not to say there is no housing problem. There is, and it is a big one, PRICES ARE TOO HIGH!

They need to come down, because first-time home buyers cannot afford starter homes, as this chart shows.

5/7

85% of all new homes are built in the South and West.
15% are built in the Northeast and Midwest.

Contrast ...

40% of the US population lives in the South and West (growing).

60% of the US population lives in the Northeast and Midwest (shrinking).

4/7

Two more things to keep in mind about new homes.

They account for just 16% of all homes sold (green), or 800k sold a year (orange), versus 4.1 million existing homes (blue) sold over the same period.

3/7

Here is the average home price (orange) and the home's size (blue). The reason prices are falling is that builders are constructing smaller homes.

But as the bottom panel shows (green), the price per square foot is as high as ever.

No bear market, just smaller homes.

1/7

This analysis concludes by saying "something is seriously wrong with the housing market."

Not based on this chart.

tl:dr - New home sizes are falling to account for this spread falling below zero. Adjust for that, and there is nothing to see here.

@DanProft @AldKnudsen43 @PaulVallas @John_Kass @GregHinz @wesbury @DianeSwonk @RahmEmanuel

The Nov Chicago Business Barometer (formerly ISM) was released y'day. It collapsed.

Something similar happened in Dec 2024, and I suggested that it was not a signal of a national downturn, but was the Chicago-area Purchasing Manager "sending a hostage note pleading for help."

Same here, consider (all in the last month):

* Property taxes assessments were mailed in November, and they soared as much as 100% in some neighborhoods.
* Illinois now  has the highest property taxes in the country
*  The Mayor wants to raise taxes on businesses.
* The Governor wants to raise the state income tax
* Several people are shot at a Christmas Tree lighting
* An entire class of 10-year-olds beat up a pregnant mother and her physically challenged son.
* A woman was doused with gasoline and set on fire on Public Transportation
* Every Monday comes with the weekend tally of crime and carnage.
* The Government and Mayor dismiss the violence as an "isolated incident" and refuse any help to get crime under control.

Frankly, I'm surprised the purchasing managers are this optimistic.

@marcuslemonis @GovPritzker @ChicagosMayor

I‚Äôm converting my home gym and starting a podcast focused on markets, nutrition, fitness, and spiritual well being. 

piped.video/@micdropwithjosh‚Ä¶

I often show my obese self, but not my skinniest after all that fasting.

Losing weight isn‚Äôt enough.

This was near my lowest well over a year ago when I lost 100 pounds before serious weight lifting.

You have to gain muscle as you get older.

It‚Äôs the currency of longevity.

If you‚Äôre in your 40s and think you can‚Äôt build muscle, you need to work a lot harder than you think.

Shit ain‚Äôt easy, but every single day I get in the best shape of my life.
Have gone as long as 9 days without food.

Give thanks to those who are no longer with us today.

The memories will never die.
